intro: Plagiogyria egenolfioides var. sumatrana, commonly known as the Sumatran plagiogyria, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia, particularly Sumatra and parts of Borneo. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, often found in lowland rainforests. Due to habitat loss, this species is considered endangered and is of interest for conservation efforts.
